author: Madz Dizon
title: Rapper GloRilla Has Sweet Handshake With Her NBA Star Boyfriend
text:
Key Points
- GloRilla and Brandon Ingram celebrated a Raptors win with a signature handshake and kiss, igniting social media reactions.
- Ingramâ€™s clutch 26-point performance helped Toronto secure its ninth straight win.
- GloRilla has been present at multiple Raptors games this season.
Toronto Raptors fans got more than just a thrilling win on Wednesday night; courtside excitement came courtesy of Grammy-nominated rapper GloRilla.
The 26-year-old artist was captured celebrating her boyfriend Brandon Ingramâ€™s clutch game-winning shot against the Indiana Pacers in a 97-95 victory. Ingramâ€™s jumper from the elbow with just 0.6 seconds left kept the Raptorsâ€™ nine-game winning streak alive, and GloRillaâ€™s courtside reaction quickly stole the spotlight.
The NBAâ€™s official Instagram shared a short clip showing the pair screaming in joy, walking into a hug, and executing a unique handshake that ended with a kiss. Fans quickly flocked to the comments, sharing their delight.

The Raptorsâ€™ win over the Pacers was fueled by Ingramâ€™s game-high 26 points, along with eight rebounds, two steals, and a block. Teammate Scottie Barnes contributed 24 points and 10 rebounds.
The Raptorsâ€™ victory also marked their fourth win in the Emirates NBA Cup, and they now hold a 14-5 record this season. Fans have noticed that Ingram, previously sidelined due to injuries, is thriving alongside teammates Barnes, RJ Barrett and Immanuel Quickley.
GloRilla and Brandon Ingramâ€™s Relationship
Although GloRilla and Ingram have not publicly confirmed their relationship, evidence points strongly to a romance. She has attended multiple Raptors games, both home and away, and has been seen wearing a No. 3 diamond chain matching Ingramâ€™s jersey number. The couple has also been spotted sharing vacation moments in Mexico, and Ingram was photographed kissing GloRilla at a previous game.
Fans are clearly loving the pairing, and social media reaction indicates excitement and support for their apparent relationship.
Beyond courtside appearances, GloRilla continues to make waves in music. Fresh off her 2024 album Glorious, she is set to headline the halftime show at the Bayou Classic alongside Grambling State Universityâ€™s Tiger Marching Band.
From dominating music charts to turning Raptors games into fashion moments, GloRilla is proving herself a multifaceted star while supporting her NBA beau in dramatic style.
